metadata.name: Apo levobunolol Ophthalmic Solution USP 0 25 2 5 mg 1mL Solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For lowering intraocular pressure IOP and may be used in patients with chronic open angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension

contraindications.disease: Bradycardia hypotension bronchospasm and acute cardiac failure LD sub 50 sub 700 mg kg orally in rat
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Levobunolol is an ophthalmic beta blocker equally effective at beta 1 and beta 2 receptor sites Levobunolol reduces both elevated and normal IOP in patients with or without glaucoma In patients with elevated IOP levobunolol reduces mean IOP by approximately 25 40 from baseline As the drug is a nonselective beta adrenergic blocking agent it can produce both systemic pulmonary and cardiovascular effects following topical application to the eye These effects include adverse pulmonary effects eg bronchoconstriction increased airway resistance and a decrease in blood pressure and heart rate

incompatibilities.description: The excretion of Levobunolol can be decreased when combined with Methimazole
The serum concentration of Levobunolol can be increased when it is combined with Escitalopram
The metabolism of Levobunolol can be decreased when combined with Dronedarone
Lasmiditan may increase the bradycardic activities of Levobunolol
The serum concentration of Levobunolol can be increased when it is combined with Givosiran
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Verapamil is combined with Levobunolol
The serum concentration of Levobunolol can be increased when it is combined with Ranolazine
The serum concentration of Levobunolol can be increased when it is combined with Haloperidol
The serum concentration of Levobunolol can be increased when it is combined with Fluoxetine
The serum concentration of the active metabolites of Octreotide can be increased when Octreotide is used in combination with Levobunolol
